OFFICIAL_MIRROR: Du tittar på den enda officiella spegeln av getlantern.org
UNOFFICIAL_MIRROR: Varning: Det här verkar inte vara en officiell getlantern.org spegel!
META_DESC: Bekämpa censuren på internet. Ge åtkomst för att öppna upp internet genom att dela anslutningar via ditt sociala nätverk.
DIRECT_LINK: Om nedladdningen inte har startat automatiskt, tryck här.
WARNING: Varning: Lantern genomgår en extern säkerhetsgranskning och väntar på sakutlåtande från den tekniska gemenskapen. Använd endast Lantern om du förstår riskerna. Om du behöver Lantern för att nå blockerade sidor, kanske detta inte fungerar tills du får en inbjudan från en användare som redan är inbjuden.
DOWNLOAD_IN_PROGRESS: Tack för att du laddade ner Lantern.
LANTERN_DESCRIPTION_1: Lantern är ett internationellt nätverk med människor som arbetar tillsammans för att besegra censureringen av internet.
LANTERN_DESCRIPTION_2: Through our new peer-to-peer censorship circumvention software, people can give and get internet access in places where access is censored.
LANTERN_DESCRIPTION_3: Together, weʼre creating an equal internet for everyone!
AN_APP_END_CENSORSHIP: An app to end Internet censorship
THANKS_FOR_DOWNLOADING: Tack för att du laddar ner!
END_CENSORSHIP_DESCRIPTION: Internet censorship hurts all of us, but we can stop it. Lantern is the app you install on your computer that opens the Internet for everyone.
USER_PRAISE_FROM_SCMP: “Lantern is the most intuitive tool to access the internet freely”
LANTERN_WORK_DESC: Lantern is an Internet proxy tool. It’s goal is access: creating fast, reliable connections to the open Internet. Lantern uses secure servers and peer access points to provide Internet access to blocked sites. Lantern is unique because it uses peer connections as a source of Internet connectivity when servers are unavailable.
LANTERN_CAPTION: Lantern users all over the world giving and getting access.
LANTERN_PARAGRAPH_1: Lantern's goal is access: creating fast, reliable connections to the open internet. With Lantern, every computer can act as a server. By running Lantern, every user with uncensored access can become an access point for those without, providing gateways to censored sites like Twitter, Facebook, and YouTube.
LANTERN_PARAGRAPH_2: The core of Lantern is the trust network. By only inviting trusted contacts and friends to share an internet connection, everyone works together to add capacity to the network while keeping it resistant to blocking by censors.
SHARE_CONNECTIONS: Dela anslutningar säkert för att besegra censur
CHECK_BACK_SOON: Försök igen senare för att ladda ner Lantern.
SAFE_TO_USE_ANSWER_1: Your Internet surfing is relatively safe with Lantern but it’s important to remember the following:
SAFE_TO_USE_ANSWER_2: — HTTPS: Remember to always use use HTTPS and ideally to install the HTTPS Everywhere browser extension, because then your traffic is always encrypted and not viewable by anyone regardless of how you are accessing the Internet. As an added bonus Lantern doesn’t allow for false HTTPS certificates.
SAFE_TO_USE_ANSWER_3: — Peers: A portion of all Lantern traffic is handled by peer proxies. It is possible for censors and other untrusted 3rd parties to run these peer proxies. You can prevent them from viewing the content of your traffic by using HTTPS, though the sites that you visit will be viewable by them.
SAFE_TO_USE_ANSWER_4: — Cookies + Privacy: Lantern does prevent other sites from seeing your IP, though it cannot prevent proxies (either peers or cloud servers) from seeing your IP.
SAFE_TO_USE_ANSWER_5: — IP addresses: If you require that no one sees your IP address or physical location (they typically can, which may come as a surprise), then you might have a better chance in improving your privacy with Tor.
SAFE_TO_USE_ANSWER_6: — Which tool is right for me?: In determining which tool to use, if speed and reliability of service are most important to you, Lantern is your tool. If you can tolerate slower speeds to post sensitive information on the Internet, you may want to use Tor.
PRIVACY_INFO_QUESTION: Vilken information samlar Lantern in om mig?
PRIVACY_INFO_ANSWER_1: Lantern allows users to provide the Lantern team with useful debugging information as well as analytics, which you can configure in your Lantern settings. If you choose to send Lantern that data, we will not use it for any other purpose other than providing the Lantern service to you and others.
CANT_REACH_USERS_QUESTION: Hur fungerar Lantern om jag inte kan nå några användare som delar åtkomst?
CANT_REACH_USERS_ANSWER_1: To help get the Lantern network started we have set up Lantern Cloud Servers. These channel a significant amount of traffic. This ensures a higher reliability of service by having a variety of sources for Internet access
COMPARE_TO_OTHER_TOOLS_QUESTION: Hur står sig Lantern jämfört med andra verktyg?
COMPARE_TO_OTHER_TOOLS_ANSWER_1: Lanterns mål är att tillhandahålla användare åtkomst och samtidigt vara snabb, säker och enkel att använda. Tor är ett annat verktyg som ibland används för att kringgå censur, dock är Tors mål att tillhandahålla anonymitet; kringgång är endast en bieffekt. Detta innebär att Tor kan vara ganska slö för att surfa på webben. I de fall då anonymitet inte är nödvändig kan Lantern erbjuda ett alternativ med snabbare åtkomst. Jämfört med andra verktyg avsedda för åtkomst (GoAgent, Freegate, Ultrasurf, Psiphon, Autoproxy) så är enkelheten med vilken programmet kan installeras och användas, samt dess pålitliga peer-to-peer nätverksarkitektur, designad för att skalas i censorers närvaro en rad av Lanterns styrkor.
COMPARE_TO_OTHER_TOOLS_ANSWER_2: Som standard körs Lantern som en systemproxy, vilket innebär att webbläsaren på din dator kommer automatiskt använda denna, utan att du behöver ändra några inställnigar.  Vissa andra verktyg fungerar endast med specifika webbläsare eller kräver omfattande konfigurering.
COMPARE_TO_OTHER_TOOLS_ANSWER_3: En annan unik aspekt med Lanterns design är dess P2P arkitektur som tillåter data att komma från många datorer samtidigt. P2P arkitekturen tillåter även nätverk att skalas till miljoner användare mycket billigare än vad mer centraliserade arkitekturer kan.
COMPARE_TO_OTHER_TOOLS_ANSWER_4: Recently, the Lantern team has contributed to uProxy, a new effort sponsored by Google Ideas. While there are similarities between the two, there are also some important differences. For one, Lantern is an independent app that stays running in the background, while uProxy is a browser extension, and currently requires asking a single friend to proxy for you on a per-session basis, so with Lantern you can have many peers give you access at the same time as opposed to just one. Another difference is Lantern allows friends of friends up to 4 degrees away to connect to one another, whereas uProxy only allows direct friends. Finally, to be faster and more blocking resistant, by default Lantern proxies access only to a specific set of sites you configure (see below), whereas uProxy reroutes traffic to all sites through your uProxy peer while you have it enabled.
PROXY_BY_DEFAULT_QUESTION: What is the Lantern proxied sites list?
PROXY_BY_DEFAULT_ANSWER_1: Lantern only provides access to blocked sites, and it does this through a default proxied sites list. Therefore, if a web site is unblocked, Lantern will get out of the way and use your regular Internet connection to send you directly to that site. That ensures that users are able to see unblocked content as quickly as possible and also that we don’t waste network resources providing access to content that is not blocked in the first place.
PROXY_BY_DEFAULT_ANSWER_2: If you are not getting access to a blocked site, that does not necessarily mean that Lantern is not working. You may need to add that site to our list of blocked sites to get access. You can do this in the settings or send an email to us at team@getlantern.org
TRUST_NETWORK_QUESTION: Hur fungerar förtroende nätverket? Vad händer när jag lägger till någon som Lantern vän?
TRUST_NETWORK_ANSWER_1: Lantern är uppbyggt på ett förtroendenätverk. Detta nätverk förbinder människor som litar på varandra för att dela internetanslutningar. När du lägger till en annan användare som Lantern vän, kan ni erbjuda varandra internet trafik via proxy. Men om Lantern endast erbjöd proxy genom direkta vänner, så skulle detta innebära att inga proxyn finns tillgängliga när inga direkta vänner ger åtkomst.
TRUST_NETWORK_ANSWER_2: För att lindra detta kan Lantern användare upptäcka en delmängd av användare som ger åtkomst hela 4 steg bort från förtroendenätverket. Till exempel om du använder Lantern för att få åtkomst, kan din brors partners moders kompis vara proxy för din Lantern trafik. Om denna person är en censor, kan hon blockera eller analysera din trafik. Å andra sidan, om du använder Lantern för att läsa eller offentliggöra något privat eller känsligt, kommer det se ut som trafiken kommer från hennes dator. På grund av detta, skall alla som kör Lantern, endast bli vänner med personer de litar på och endast använda Lantern som proxy för trafik som inte är privat eller känslig.
TRUST_NETWORK_ANSWER_3: Genom att endast lägga till människor du litar på, skyddar du både dig själv, dina vänner och deras vänner. Genom att tillåta användare att upptäcka en delmängd av användare längre bort från deras förtroendenätverk, ökar Lanterns tillgängliga proxyn samtidigt som man bibehåller resistansen mot blockering.
DOWNLOAD_LANTERN_ANSWER_1: Lantern accepterar inte längre begäran om inbjudningar. För att skydda Lantern mot infiltration av censorer görs nu alla inbjudningar av vänner till vänner. Om du känner och litar på någon som redan använder Lantern var god kontakta dom och begär en inbjudan.
CAN_I_STILL_HELP_QUESTION: Ja bor i en region som saknar censur och känner ingen i en censurerad region. Kan jag fortfarande hjälpa till?
CAN_I_STILL_HELP_ANSWER_1: Definitely! You can both run Lantern and invite more people to join the cause, even if those people also live in an uncensored region. When you run Lantern, you will be added to our DNS round-robin so that a small portion of overall traffic gets routed through your machine. While Lantern also runs its own servers to ensure a good quality of service, each user helps reduce that burden. Our ultimate goal is to build a system that bypasses censorship even if we cease to exist as a company, and that is only possible if a lot of people run it to create new access points. When you invite more people, they will help lighten the load further for everyone.
INSTALLED_LANTERN_QUESTION: OK, Jag har installerat Lantern. Vad händer nu?
INSTALLED_LANTERN_ANSWER_1: För användare i censurerade regioner, finns det två grundläggande saker som du kan göra efter att ha installerat Lantern:
INSTALLED_LANTERN_ANSWER_2: — Kör Lantern så mycket som möjligt.
INSTALLED_LANTERN_ANSWER_3: — Lägg till fler tillförlitliga användare som Lantern vänner.
INSTALLED_LANTERN_ANSWER_4: Whenever you run Lantern, you create a new access point users in censored regions can use to access the open Internet. Remember, though, that your own social network is part of what enables Lantern to stay unblocked, so inviting your contacts to join the cause is an important step!
VULNERABLE_TO_HACKERS_QUESTION: Kommer Lantern att göra min dator sårbar för hackare?
VULNERABLE_TO_HACKERS_ANSWER_1: Lantern tar ett antal försiktighetsåtgärder för att säkerhetsställa användarnas säkerhet. För det första, Lantern tillåter ingen som ansluter till dig att läsa innehållet på din dator. Den tillåter helt enkelt endast delningen av internetanslutningen. Datan som skickas er emellan är krypterad så att inga mellanhänder (t.ex. myndigheter eller internetleverantörer) kan läsa denna. Lantern kräver även ömsesidig autentisering för alla anslutningar, vilket innebär att Lantern endast kommer tillåta användare att ansluta till dig som verifierats och är i ditt Lantern nätverk.
WHO_ARE_WE_ANSWER_1: Lantern is built by the Brave New Software Project, Inc, a registered 501c3 non-profit dedicated to using software to tackle tough global challenges. Brave New Software’s founder and Lantern lead developer, Adam Fisk, was formerly a lead developer of the peer-to-peer file sharing services LimeWire and LittleShoot. While working on these P2P architectures, Adam realized they could be useful in providing unfiltered internet access. You can watch some of Adam’s talks about Lantern here and here.
IS_LANTERN_FREE_QUESTION: Är Lantern gratis? Kommer det kosta mig något?
IS_LANTERN_FREE_ANSWER_1: Lantern is a free, open source software. It is free to use, modify, and redistribute.
IS_LANTERN_FREE_ANSWER_2: If your Internet connection has a data limit, then giving access through Lantern will be included in your usage.
SAFE_TO_PROVIDE_ACCESS_QUESTION: Is it safe for me to use Lantern to provide access to the Internet?
SAFE_TO_PROVIDE_ACCESS_ANSWER_1: For users with unrestricted Internet access in the uncensored world running as access points, Lantern currently allows other people to access any site on the internet via your connection, including ones that you may disagree with or that may be illegal in your jurisdiction. In future releases of Lantern, those giving access will be able to limit which sites other people can access via their internet connection.
MORE_QUESTIONS_QUESTION: Jag har fler frågor, vart ska jag vända mig?
MORE_QUESTIONS_ANSWER_1: Om du har mer tekniska frågor, var god besök Utvecklare Frågor och Svar. Du kan även fråga på användarforumet eller utvecklarforumet.
DOWNLOADING_LANTERN_1: Lantern is currently in closed beta. To download Lantern, you need to be invited by someone who is already using Lantern. If you don't have any friends who can invite you, add your email address to the signup form.
LANTERN_CLOUD_SERVERS_1: Lantern Cloud Servers are small Amazon EC2 instances that serve as fallbacks when there are not enough peer users online.
LANTERN_CLOUD_SERVERS_2: This ensures that people will be able to get connected, even if a friend is not online. They help make the Lantern Network much more robust.
LANTERN_CLOUD_SERVERS_3: Unfortunately these servers cost money to maintain, so Brave New Software, the organization behind Lantern, can only supply a limited number of them. If you would like to help you can soon sponsor your own Lantern Cloud Server at http://rally.org (coming soon) If you are in a censored country this provides direct access for you and your friends. And its a great way to give from uncensored countries, increasing the reliability of the Lantern Network.
LANTERN_CLOUD_SERVERS_4: Since our Rally integration is not yet working please get in touch at contact [at] getlantern.org and we can take your donation and fire up a dedicated server for you.
QUITTING_LANTERN_1: We encourage you to just leave Lantern running in the background, so it can help censored users get access even while you're doing other tasks. If you close the Network Map window, a lantern icon still appears in your notification area.
QUITTING_LANTERN_2: The following instructions show you how to quit the Lantern application on different operating systems.
QUITTING_LANTERN_3: Click the Lantern icon and select Quit Lantern.
EMAILING_HEADER: Occasionally the core Lantern developers will request for you to email them your logs to better diagnose an issue.
EMAILING_HEADER2: To do this you need to find the logs directory on your platform:
EMAILING_HEADER3: The directory should have files in it like java.log, installer.log and others. Zip up the whole directory in to a single zip file. Sometimes it may only contain java.log, which is the most important file. You can zip it to be smaller, or just send it as is.
EMAILING_HEADER4: Attach the zip or the java log file to an email sent to contact [at] getlantern.org. If you are very security focused and want a pgp email address to send it to let us know and we can provide one.
GET_INVOLVED_1: As with any open source project, Lantern will only be truly successfully if you help out. Right now we’re in a ‘beta’ state, with tons to do before we spread it to the world. And most of the tasks we need help on require no programming knowledge. Developers are of course more than welcome, but this page is for everyone else to find a way to help make Lantern great.
GET_INVOLVED_3: If you have an uncensored internet connection, you can make a difference simply by keeping Lantern running. Every additional user sharing her connection makes the Lantern network work that much better, and that much harder to block for censors.
GET_INVOLVED_4: Whether or not you have an uncensored internet connection, you can also help by inviting people you trust to join the Lantern network. Lantern relies on a large network of users who trust one another to share internet connections, so the more trusted connections in the network, the better Lantern will work. So if you are an early user please spread Lantern among your trusted friends to help the network grow.
GET_INVOLVED_6: At the current ‘beta’ stage of development one of the most valuable things you can do is report to us if it is not working for you. The ideal way to do this is on the users forum. If you don’t feel comfortable with your name in public feel free to use dummy account / name. You can also use the ‘contact’ form from Lantern itself to send a message privately to the core developers.
GET_INVOLVED_7: The most important thing to let us know is if you are in a censored country and are unable to connect at all. But feel free to report more minor errors, and also to make suggestions about ways that Lantern could work better for you. Try to give as much detail as possible. See this how to report bugs effectively for general guidelines. For Lantern be sure to include your operating system, where you are, and if you are in ‘give’ or ‘get’ mode (all users in censored countries are automatically in ‘get’), and what version of Lantern you’re running.
GET_INVOLVED_8: The above is 1.0.0-beta2, you should see some number there.
GET_INVOLVED_9: You also may be asked to email your logs for the developers to diagnose. See Emailing Lantern Logs.
GET_INVOLVED_10: If you are a fluent speaker of another language and would like to help translate Lantern’s web site, documentation, or the application itself, we would welcome your participation. See Translating Lantern.
GET_INVOLVED_12: We also welcome people who are interested in helping spread the word about Lantern. We are mostly software developers, but unlike most developers our software will only work if lots of people in uncensored countries run it. So we welcome ideas and actions to get more and more people to run Lantern. Social media campaigns, magazine articles, blog posts, videos, kickstarter, etc. - if you’ve got experience promoting great stuff then get in touch. And no idea is too big or too small. For right now just introduce yourself on the users forum. If we get enough people there we will start a dedicated forum.
GET_INVOLVED_14: This collaboratively-maintained wiki documentation is a work in progress. If you see an area that needs more work and you would like to pitch in, we welcome your help. Right now you need to be added to the Documentation Team to edit, just let us know of your interest on the forum. Then to edit just use the “New Page” or “Edit Page” buttons near the top of any wiki page.
GET_INVOLVED_16: If you are a developer and are interested in helping build Lantern, see Contributing Code.
GET_INVOLVED_18: Besides running Lantern on your own computer to share an uncensored internet connection, you can also pledge a one-time or monthly donation to sponsor a Lantern cloud proxy, which provides an additional high-capacity internet connection to the network 24 hours a day, even while your computer is off or disconnected. Alternatively, if there is some feature or bugfix you’d like to see in the next version of Lantern, you can sponsor its development.
GET_INVOLVED_19: Please contact the Lantern developers about either of these options if you would like to inquire further.
GET_INVOLVED_20: You can also just make a 1-click microdonation to the cause in general using Flattr or GitTip:
GET_INVOLVED_21: Thank you for your interest in contributing to Lantern. A vibrant and active community is vital to our existence.
SWITCHING_GOOGLE_1: You can change the Google email that you use with Lantern by resetting Lantern and going through the initial setup sequence.
SWITCHING_GOOGLE_3: As awesome as it is to watch Lantern connections crossing the globe, most of the time you will probably have Lantern running without the network map visible.
SWITCHING_GOOGLE_4: Select Show Lantern from the Lantern icon in the Status Bar.
SWITCHING_GOOGLE_6: Next, reset Lantern and go through the setup process again. Resetting Lantern clears all saved information since your last setup
SETUP_1: When you first run Lantern you will be asked a series of questions.
SETUP_3: The first question is if you want to ‘give’ or ‘get’ access.
SETUP_4: ‘Give Access’ is for users in uncensored countries who want to share their internet connection. This turns their computer into a proxy that their trusted Lantern friends can use for free to access the open internet. Lantern runs in the background, and we encourage you to leave it on whenever you can, so your friends can always use your connection.
SETUP_5: ‘Get Access’ is for users in censored countries who want access to the internet. Lantern uses a ‘peer-to-peer’ approach to stream internet access from all your trusted Lantern friends at once. So the more Lantern friends in other countries that you add the better your connection will be.
SETUP_7: The next step is to sign in to your Google account. Lantern leverages your existing Google contacts to build up its social network.
SETUP_8: The sign-in page is served directly from Google. Your password goes straight to Google’s servers, Lantern never stores or even sees the password.
SETUP_10: After you enter your information you will be prompted to authorize Lantern to view your email and basic information, and to view and send chat messages. Lantern asks about chat messages because it uses Google’s chat communication channels to bootstrap its network. Hit authorize, or Lantern will not work properly.
SETUP_12: If you chose Get, see Configuring Proxied Sites. Note that the proxied sites configuration page can be reached at any time by Get users by clicking on the globe icon in the lower right.
SETUP_13: Users Giving access will not see this step. Though you are welcome to switch modes to experience what Lantern would be like for a user Getting access.
